text: Alicja Konieczek (born 2 November 1994) is a Polish runner specialising in the 3000 metres steeplechase. In 2020 she joined the prestigious On Athletics Club sponsored by Swiss company ON Running. She won the gold medal at the 2019 Summer Universiade. She took fifth place at the European Team Championships in Bydgoszcz. She also participated at the IAAF World Championships in Qatar. Her younger sister Aneta is also a runner that currently is at the University of Oregon. She has multiply medals from the Polish Championships and few Polish records in different age categories. Their older brother Dawid was also a runner that graduated from college in Colorado. He won few medals at the age National Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2011 |World Youth Championships |Lille, France |21st (h) |2000 m s'chase |6:55.31 |- |2013 |European Junior Championships |Rieti, Italy |21st (h) |3000 m s'chase |10:59.80 |- |2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |17th (h) |3000 m s'chase |9:41.16 |- |rowspan=2|2019 |Universiade |Naples, Italy |bgcolor=gold|1st |3000 m s'chase |9:41.46 |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |28th (h) |3000 m s'chase |9:44.96 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *800 metres – 2:15.16 (Biała Podlaska 2014) *1500 metres – 4:21.68 (Long Beach 2017) *3000 metres – 10:10.51 (Słubice 2014) *5000 metres – 15:59.22 (Palo Alto 2017) *3000 metres steeplechase – 9:36.09 (Joensuu 2019) Indoor *800 metres – 2:11.70 (Albuquerque 2020) *mile – 4:37.42 (Birmingham, AL 2017) *3000 metres – 9:17:90 (Seattle, WA, 2017) ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Polish female steeplechase runners Category:People from Zbąszyń Category:Universiade gold medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade gold medalists for Poland Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Alicja Konieczek
